Author: RAIMU R120
Review:
It's a sad fact that the typhoon damaged a valuable building with a long history, but the fact that it's being repaired little by little is a place where we can be proud of valuing Japanese things.
The fact that I was able to see the cherry blossoms in this coldest time of the year and seeing the petals of the cherry blossoms warmed my heart.
By all means, I would like to come again in the spring when the cherry blossoms are in full bloom.

Author: Maboo Nakano
Review: Hirano Shrine = cherry blossoms. There are still two weeks left until the cherry blossoms bloom, and even though I passed the approach, I didn't feel any signs of cherry blossoms. Cherry blossoms were blooming in October. This cherry blossom originated in Tibet, and it seems that it starts blooming in early autumn, takes a break in winter, and blooms again in spring. I was relieved to see cherry blossoms that I have never seen before.

Hirano Shrine is a well-known cherry blossom viewing spot. However, due to the typhoon, it has been severely damaged, and important buildings such as the main hall are still under renovation.

Author: D. Zawa
Review:
There is a theory that it was founded in the Enryaku era, which was almost the same time as the foundation of Heian-kyo. It started when the gods that were originally enshrined in Heijo-kyo were enshrined near the Daidairi when the capital was moved.
The main hall has a special structure called Kasugahi Yokuzukuri or Hiranozukuri, and consists of two buildings with four halls.

"shock"

Author: JH LEE
Review:
It has a long history as a shrine that moved from Nara along with the transfer of the Heian capital. There are many cherry blossom trees inside, and it is famous as a beautiful shrine during the cherry blossom season.

It's small in scale and there are large shrines like Kitano Tenmanku nearby when it's not cherry blossom season, so if you want to visit a shrine, you don't have to come here.

The god enshrined in this shrine is Imaki, but the theory that Imaki is the King of Baekje is a minority theory and has not been recognized academically.

Review: Beautiful shrine! Discovered by chance after a visit to Kitano Tenmangu. Come here if you want to relax.

Author: Ming Rhee Chai
Review: The Sakura park with payment of 500yen is undeniably astonishing. However, there is one Japanese male staff at the exit area who was supposed to sell the souvenirs sat there most of the time and was being racist to Chinese Speaking tourists. First thing first, Japan tourism should be more aware of your staff intake to prevent them being RACIST, second thing we are Malaysian but we speaks multiple languages. We are not like you , only able to speak one language and still proud of that. Third thing the weather was only 9-10degree Celsius, we stood around the electrical heater/stove but the racist staff purposely switch off the heater. Hello? Excuse me , are you sane? We are freezing cold and you purposely off it just because you thought we are Chinese from China. What kind of third world mindset is that? These absent minded acts has bring very bad impressions toward Japan. Last but not least, if you think you do not welcome Chinese speaking tourist to Japan, you can always inform us over Japan tourism advertisement. We are ok with that.

Author: shig M.
Review: 2023/4/1 is hot and sunny. It was a night when the cherry blossoms were shining. It costs 500 yen per adult to enter, but if you just want to see the cherry blossoms at night and take beautiful photos, I think it's worth it. It's crowded, but the site is wide, so you can take pictures everywhere. I'm glad I came.

Author: TO RU
Review: Visited on April 2nd. This year, the cherry blossoms were in full bloom early and the cherry blossoms were scattered, but there were still various kinds of cherry blossoms in bloom, and I realized that it is a famous cherry blossom spot that represents Kyoto. It was a pleasant walk with the warm weather along with Kitano Tenmangu Shrine next door.

Author: YiFang Chen
Review:
2023/3/31 First visit
Cherry blossoms in full bloom and bright yellow flowers are a different visual feast.

The following brief introduction (citing Wikipedia)

Hirano Shrine (Japanese: Hirano Shrine) is a shrine located in Hirano Miyahonmachi, Kita District, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Japan. Taisha (the other table shrine of the current main hall of the shrine). The divine pattern is "Sakura". The main hall of Hirano Shrine is an Important Cultural Property of Japan. Hirano Shrine is also a famous holy place for viewing cherry blossoms, especially famous for "night cherry blossoms".

Author: Aki o24o
Review:
As you know, it is a famous place for cherry blossoms.

West side of Kitano Tenmangu Shrine
The main entrance is on the east side, but since there is a west entrance on Nishioji-dori, most people visit here.

But the approach to the shrine on the east side is beautiful, so if you can, please visit from here.

The bus stop is between Waratenjin-mae and Kinugasa-ko-mae.
Waratenjin-mae is slightly higher up the slope.

There is no tea shop in the precincts
If you walk towards the bus stop in front of Wara Tenjin, you will see a soba restaurant ahead of Supermarket Nakamura, and an udon restaurant just in front of Wara Tenjin.

Author: Kenzo
Review: Amazing cherry blossom bloom in the end of March. Located behind Kitano Tenmangu.

Author: Terence Lee
Review: Pretty during cherry blossoms

Author: S T
Review: Came here early morning 8am with no crowds. Different types of sakura seen. Very nice.

Author: Will Trively [Zargos] (Will)
Review: While it's a lovely shrine, they block off a majority of the grounds to charge tourists and Japanese alike to see the cherry blossoms. There are places to view all over Kyoto. So unless you want to have a secluded picnic within a red and white barrier, it's not worth paying. I went around the outside and took photos over the top of the barrier. The shrine is still fully accessible.

Author: „Éï„Ç°
Review: The main shrine and south gate are from the 1600s, but the shrine was relocated when the capital was relocated to Heiankyo. About 20 minutes walk from Kinkakuji. (It's a gentle downhill from Kinkakuji) In 2023, the cherry blossoms bloomed early, and on April 9th, the cherry blossoms were over. Take a close-up shot of a slightly blooming flower.

Author: Mehm San Kha

Author: „Åä„Åó„ÇçÂ§™ÈÉé
Review:
There is Kitano Tenmangu Shrine nearby, but this time I went to Hirano Shrine for this squirrel and cherry blossom omikuji.

Cherry blossoms are famous, but there are varieties that can be enjoyed even in the second half of April, so it was the best time to see them.

The number of tourists in Kyoto is increasing suddenly, but here it was a good feeling with less people.

I had a feeling that it would be nice to have a sacred tree as a standby.

Author: Shin1 A.
Review: In spring, the cherry blossoms are beautiful, so I couldn't see someiyoshino because it was a little late, but I was able to see double cherry blossoms. I have the impression that the road to the precincts is not well maintained, or that weeds are growing and maintenance is not keeping up. It's a small shrine, but it has a nice atmosphere, so I think it would be nice if it was taken care of according to the season. The parking lot has coin parking.

Author: „ÉÄ„É¨„Éã„Ç™„Çπ
Review:
There are 200 cherry blossoms of 60 varieties, and you can enjoy cherry blossoms for a month and a half.
When you pass through the gate, there is a rock that looks like a magnet.
When the cherry blossoms aren't blooming, it's quiet and I think you can visit without worrying about other people.

Author: Jos√© Alberto Serrano
Review: So beautiful and clean

Author: „Åï„Åè„Çâ„Åï„Åè
Review:
Hirano Shrine is famous during the cherry blossom season, but the fresh green season is also wonderful.
There is a gemstone called "Suehirogane" that a magnet sticks to. There is also a large camphor tree, which is a sacred tree.
It's a shrine that makes you feel very energetic, and I love it.

Author: Jamie Lin
Review:
20230410
Hirano Shrine Cherry Blossom Festival
The cherry blossoms that bloomed two weeks earlier disrupted the pace of tourists and the festival. The festival is a fixed date and should not be easily changed. We were at Kitano Tenmangu Shrine, on the side of Qixuan, and met a detour team at about 3:30 in the afternoon. A rare experience.

Author: ling Chou
Review: The Hirano Shrine in Kyoto is an important cultural property of Japan. It enshrines the Imaki Emperor. It was originally the Hirano Shrine built in the Nara Heijo Palace during the Emperor Guangren‚Äôs time. Because his son Emperor Kanmu moved the capital to Heiankyo, the Imaki Emperor was moved to the present. The location of Hirano Shrine. Hirano Shrine is also a must-see place for cherry blossom viewing. There are more than 60 types of cherry blossoms and a total of 400 cherry blossoms. The flowering period can be said to be the longest cherry blossom spot in Kyoto. The shrine is beautiful!

Author: ÁôΩËìÆ
Review: Compared with Kitano Tenmangu, there are quite few people at the foothold of the fourth station, but there is a very special "Kui" tree. It takes about 5 minutes to walk from Tenmangu, so you can take a look.
